titleInfo.title: R U N A W A Y.

mods.abstract: R U N A W A Y . WAS committed to the jail of this parish a negro man named ARMISTED, aged about 22 years; says he belongs to John Slaughter, on Bayou Plaquemines, parish of Iberville; said slave is about 6 feet in height. The owner is requested to come forward, pay charges, and take him out of jail. M. AGUILLAR, Jailor. Point Coupee, March 12th, 1859.

detail.title: Pointe Coupee Democrat. : (False River [i.e. New Roads], Parish of Pointe Coupee [La.]) 1858-1870

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
